issues.summary: Benelux Premium Pricing
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Content*

*Phase 1 (M0): Green Chef NL to HelloFresh NL Migration*

* Phase 1 focuses on the migration of approximately *6,000 active Green Chef Netherlands customers* to the HelloFresh NL Premium tier. This migration is necessary due to Green Chef's closing and is intended to give these customers a better home

*Phase 2 (M1): HelloFresh Premium Tier A/B Test*

* Phase 2 involves the launch of the Premium tier option for *active HelloFresh customers* in the Netherlands, Belgium, and Luxembourg. It would also include an A/B test to measure the impact on the business.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Documentation:*

* [https://docs.google.com/document/d/15ed_XKz9mITBJR9kPbc607YskJtQ-izQCrGkopcICGw/edit?tab=t.jwwlvys34aag#heading=h.e8pb13jctmh4|https://docs.google.com/document/d/15ed_XKz9mITBJR9kPbc607YskJtQ-izQCrGkopcICGw/edit?tab=t.jwwlvys34aag#heading=h.e8pb13jctmh4|smart-link] 
* [https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/2cd0b4e0-f8b8-4a93-8a2b-dd7560547b8d|https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/2cd0b4e0-f8b8-4a93-8a2b-dd7560547b8d]
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Hypothesis*

*Phase 1 (M0): Green Chef NL to HelloFresh NL Migration*

* The migration is driven by the need to give Green Chef Netherlands customers a *better home* because Green Chef was underperforming and is being closed down. The core hypothesis is that successfully migrating these customers to a newly created *Premium Tier* will allow HelloFresh to *retain* valuable revenue from the existing Green Chef customer base.
* This is achieved by offering the Green Chef customers a dedicated product family that maintains a price point close to what they were currently paying, thereby *avoiding price friction* during the migration and maximizing retention of the approximately 6,000 active GC customers.
* The Premium tier offering is intended to be relevant to these customers, as the regular HelloFresh product would not be premium enough compared to what they were used to at Green C

issues.summary: NPS: Investigate recent spike in 503 errors
issues.description:
There was a recent spike in 503 errors for the Nutritional Profile Service (NPS) starting on December 2nd. Previously, from November 20th to 30th, there were barely any errors. The last known issue involved a degraded {{virtualService}} key for Rollouts in Argo CD, which was manually removed and re-created. Currently, the service appears healthy in Argo. This ticket is to investigate the cause of the recent spike and ensure the issue is resolved.

_Issue created in Slack from a_ [_message_|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C088GTM8QTF/p1765198340137879?thread_ts=1763549463.210359&cid=C088GTM8QTF]_._

issues.summary: NVS - FTCP migrate to new-partition
issues.description:
h2. Summary

Migrate all NVS services to a new partition. This process involves several steps to ensure a smooth transition without impacting existing services.

h2. Context

This migration requires a manual process as there is no automatic mechanism available. The old partition will be frozen at a specific commit SHA after the migration begins.

h2. Acceptance criteria

* *Prerequisites*:
** GitHub repository access
** kubectl access to *tools* cluster
** Write permissions in *argo-cd* namespace
** Ability to update consumer services
* *Migration Steps*:
*# Freeze the old partition by pinning the ApplicationSet to the current commit SHA.
*# Deploy to the new partition by adding a {{partition}} label to the config file.
*# Migrate traffic by updating consumers to new partition endpoints.
*# Cleanup by deleting the old ApplicationSet after verifying stability.
* *Verification*:
** Ensure 100% traffic is routed to the new partition.
** Confirm no dependencies on the old partition.
** Check application stability before deletion.

h2. Other information

* *Migration Guide*: [Moving Application to New Partition|https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/fault-tolerant-container-platform/docs/ftcp-open-application-model/migration/partition-migration-guideline/#migration-guide-moving-application-to-new-partition]
* *Quick Summary*: This document is still under evaluation. Reach out to #tribe-reliability-platform for more details.
* *Key Points*:
** Repeat the process for each environment (Stage first, then Prod).
** Both partitions will run simultaneously during migration.
* *ArgoCD*: Check [ArgoCD|https://argocd.tools-k8s.hellofresh.io/] for application status.
* *Checklist*:
** Found commit SHA from GitHub branch.
** Checked both ApplicationSet fields.
** Pinned old ApplicationSet to commit SHA.
** Added partition to config file.
** Verified new partition deployment.
** Migrated traffic to new partition.
** Deleted old ApplicationSet.

issues.summary: RTE Systems - Update Slack Commander for new public Slack channels
issues.description:
Update the *Slack Commander* configuration to reflect the transition from the old Slack channel *#squad-rte-systems* to the new public Slack channel *#squad-market-io*, ensuring smooth communication and operational efficiency for the newly formed *Market Innovation & Optimization (MIO)* team.

This task involves modifying the Slack Commander settings to remove references to the old channel and integrate the new one, ensuring that all commands and automation workflows are properly assigned to the MIO team.

*Action Items:*

* Remove *#rte-systems* from the Slack Commander configuration.
* Add the new Slack channel *#squad-market-io* to the configuration.
* Ensure all relevant commands and workflows are correctly mapped to the new channel.
* Conduct tests to verify that commands function as expected in the new channel.
* Update any documentation to reflect the changes.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* The new Slack channel is successfully integrated with Slack Commander.
* The old Slack channel is removed from configurations where necessary.
* All relevant commands and workflows function correctly in the new channel.
* Stakeholders are informed about the transition.

comments.author: Davor Juric
comments.body: Work for this ticket was completed under the https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-37

issues.summary: MIO Reteaming transition (Restructuring Tasks)
issues.description:
To successfully configure the new *MIO (Market Innovation & Optimization Squad)* team structure, we need to complete a series of tasks outlined in the provided [tracking sheet|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GBMyZWQ_MLnXT4WzT20cYmuyLwHQUmsRYeEOrlAPCGc/edit?gid=0#gid=0]. This initiative involves the merging of New Ventures Systems and the RTE Systems team into a single *MIO* entity. We will focus on updating team ownership, aligning key metrics, and ensuring a seamless transition of responsibilities and workflows.

We will follow the outlined tasks in the sheet to create individual tickets for each area, ensuring a structured and efficient transition process.

*Key tasks to be completed include:*

* Merging team processes and defining new operational workflows
* Setting up team ceremonies
* Conducting onboarding sessions
* Creating a new Confluence space
* Establishing a dedicated Slack channel and user group
* Configuring Google Groups for team email
* Setting up Azure groups
* Implementing Dora metrics tracking
* Updating HF Inspector configurations
* Managing Helm Charts and Comply files
* Defining Team Claims JSONs

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Successful consolidation of *New Ventures Systems* and RTE Systems teams under *MIO (Market Innovation & Optimization Squad)*
* All operational systems and tools are updated to reflect the new structure
* Relevant stakeholders are informed and onboarded

This epic will serve as the central reference point for tracking progress and completion of all related tasks to ensure a smooth integration of the teams.

issues.summary: RTE Systems - Update helm Charts & Comply Files with proper team details on applicable repos
issues.description:
Update the *Helm Charts and Comply Files* across applicable repositories to reflect the correct team details for the newly formed *Market Innovation & Optimization(MIO)* team, previously managed under the RTE Systems squad (RTE Systems).

This task involves reviewing and modifying ownership details, metadata, and configuration settings to align with the new team structure and ensure compliance with internal standards.

*Action Items:*

* Identify all relevant repositories requiring updates.
* Review and update team ownership details within Helm Charts.
* Modify Comply Files to reflect the correct MIO team information.
* Ensure consistency across all affected repositories.
* Validate changes through pull request reviews and approvals.

*Reference:*

* Utilize the provided example PRs as a guideline for making the necessary updates.
** [https://github.com/hellofresh/github-automation/blob/master/repositories/tax-service/.comply.yaml|https://github.com/hellofresh/github-automation/blob/master/repositories/tax-service/.comply.yaml]  
** [https://github.com/hellofresh/tax-service/blob/3592ccda8da5c825be6702ceea1a03fa0248228d/ahoy/tax-service/values-live.yaml#L1|https://github.com/hellofresh/tax-service/blob/3592ccda8da5c825be6702ceea1a03fa0248228d/ahoy/tax-service/values-live.yaml#L1]  

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All applicable repositories have updated Helm Charts and Comply Files.
* PRs are submitted and approved following the team's review process.
* Documentation is updated to reflect the changes where applicable.

This task is critical to maintaining accurate ownership records and ensuring a smooth transition to the new MIO team structure.

issues.summary: NVS - Update Sentry teams & Alerts
issues.description:
Update the *Sentry teams and alert configurations* to reflect the newly formed *Market Innovation and Optimization (MIO)* team, replacing the previous New Ventures Systems squad (NVS) ownership.

This task involves modifying Sentry settings to ensure that all error tracking, alerts, and team assignments are correctly aligned with the MIO team structure.

*Action Items:*

* Review current Sentry team configurations and alert rules.
* Update ownership details to assign MIO as the responsible team.
* Ensure alert routing and notification settings reflect the new team structure.
* Validate changes by triggering test alerts where applicable.
* Document any updates made for future reference.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Sentry reflects the updated MIO team ownership.
* Alerts and notifications are correctly routed to the appropriate MIO channels.
* Changes are tested and verified for accuracy.

issues.summary: RTE Systems - Ensure new team labels and comply files are linked and aggregated in DORA dashboards
issues.description:
Ensure that the newly formed *Market Innovation and Optimization (MIO)* team labels and Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within the *DORA dashboards*, replacing the previous RTE Systems squad (RTE Systems) details. This will help maintain accurate tracking of key performance indicators such as deployment frequency, lead time for changes, change failure rate, and mean time to recovery.

*Action Items:*

* Review the current DORA dashboard configuration and identify existing RTE Systems references.
* Update team labels to reflect the MIO team across all relevant dashboards.
* Ensure Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within DORA metrics.
* Validate that all key metrics are accurately displayed and aligned with the new team structure.
* Conduct a review with stakeholders to confirm proper tracking.

*Reference:*

* [DORA Metrics |https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PLAT/pages/3903685457/How+to+correctly+get+assigned+DORA+dashboard+metrics+into+your+squad]

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All MIO team labels and Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within the DORA dashboards.
* The [DORA dashboard|https://tableau.hellofresh.io/#/views/DORAmetrics/Overview?:iid=1] display accurate metrics aligned with the new team structure.
* Confirmation from stakeholders that the updates meet reporting requirements.

issues.summary: NVS - Ensure new team labels and comply files are linked and aggregated in DORA dashboards
issues.description:
Ensure that the newly formed *Market Innovation and Optimization (MIO)* team labels and Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within the *DORA dashboards*, replacing the previous New Ventures Systems squad (NVS) details. This will help maintain accurate tracking of key performance indicators such as deployment frequency, lead time for changes, change failure rate, and mean time to recovery.

*Action Items:*

* Review the current DORA dashboard configuration and identify existing NVS references.
* Update team labels to reflect the MIO team across all relevant dashboards.
* Ensure Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within DORA metrics.
* Validate that all key metrics are accurately displayed and aligned with the new team structure.
* Conduct a review with stakeholders to confirm proper tracking.

*Reference:*

* [DORA Metrics |https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PLAT/pages/3903685457/How+to+correctly+get+assigned+DORA+dashboard+metrics+into+your+squad]

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All MIO team labels and Comply files are correctly linked and aggregated within the DORA dashboards.
* The [DORA dashboard|https://tableau.hellofresh.io/#/views/DORAmetrics/Overview?:iid=1] display accurate metrics aligned with the new team structure.
* Confirmation from stakeholders that the updates meet reporting requirements.

issues.summary: NVS - Update team & Claim JSON files with proper team details on applicable repos
issues.description:
Update the *team and Claim JSON files* across applicable repositories to reflect the correct team details for the newly formed *Market Innovation & Optimization (MIO)* team, previously managed under the New Ventures Systems squad (NVS).

This task involves modifying ownership information and ensuring that all relevant repositories accurately represent the updated team structure.

*Action Items:*

* Review the provided payload to identify necessary updates.
* Update team and Claim JSON files with the correct MIO team details.
* Ensure consistency and accuracy across all applicable repositories.
* Submit pull requests for review and approval.

*Reference:*

* Use the provided [PR|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/.teams/market-launch.json] as a guideline for implementing the changes.

{noformat}{
  "name": "market-innovation",
  "githubTeam": "hellofresh/market-innovation-and-optimization",
  "tribe": "new-ventures",
  "alliance": "consumer-mega",
  "jiraPrefix": "MIO",
  "slackChannel": "#squad-market-io",
  "slackAlertsChannel": "#mio-live-alerts",
  "skipLabelsOnPR": false
}{noformat}

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All relevant repositories have updated team and Claim JSON files.
* PRs are submitted, reviewed, and approved.
* Changes are validated to ensure accuracy and compliance with internal guidelines.

comments.author: Davor Juric
comments.body: This ticket is blocked until the github-automation changes are merged so that the CODEOWNERS files can be updated.

comments.author: Wanderley Teixeira
comments.body: [~accountid:557058:1b19be97-e47d-4a8d-9fab-d5ab114cf190] Sure, moving it back to backlog.

issues.summary: Backend services handover documentation
issues.description:
We need to document and align with all stakeholders on the handover and/or deprecation of backend services.

* Complete operational service handovers to other domains following the TRE guidelines.
* Develop a high-level  [+New Ventures: Backend services Ownership and Future plans+|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1shgXBKw6Mfz2uRnHWvSIBnlLmDxi1f71s5SZUqlJWEk/edit?tab=t.0] outlining the deprecation of all TAM backend services.
* Create TRE Handover Guides (e.g.,[+[RTE Manufacturing - Youfoodz] B2B Ownership TRE Handover Guide+|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ySmlmm15SnFye3yB1Fo_TJOuRKaMIB0Nd0uoQR1zEy0/edit?tab=t.0]) by end of 2025. Attach to this ticket and create separate tasks for each.
* *Schedule & Sync:* Finalize by Week 2–3 of 2026.
* *Kickoff:* Begin in Week 4 of 2026, with completion targeted for Q1 2026.

Backend service list:

{adf:display=block}

issues.summary: RTE Systems - Update team details in HF Inspector
issues.description:
Update the *team details in the HF Inspector tool* to reflect the newly formed *Market Innovation & Optimization (MIO)* team, consolidating ownership previously managed by the RTE Systems squad (RTE Systems).

This task involves updating the team information within the HF Inspector tool to ensure accurate representation and proper tracking of services under the new team structure.

*Action Items:*

* Access the HF Inspector tool and locate existing RTE Systems team details.
* Update the team name, ownership, and any relevant metadata to reflect the MIO team.
* Verify that all associated services and dependencies are correctly linked to the updated team.
* Conduct a review to ensure all changes align with organizational standards.

Reference [doc|https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/hf-inspector/docs/slack-bot/]

Team name: Market Innovation & Optimization

Slack channel: #squad-market-io

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* HF Inspector tool reflects the correct MIO team details.
* All relevant services and components are updated accordingly.
* Changes are reviewed and confirmed by stakeholders.

issues.summary: NVS - Update Sentry teams & Alerts
issues.description:
Update the *Sentry teams and alert configurations* to reflect the newly formed *Market Innovation and Optimization (MIO)* team, replacing the previous New Ventures Systems squad (NVS) ownership.

This task involves modifying Sentry settings to ensure that all error tracking, alerts, and team assignments are correctly aligned with the MIO team structure.

*Action Items:*

* Review current Sentry team configurations and alert rules.
* Update ownership details to assign MIO as the responsible team.
* Ensure alert routing and notification settings reflect the new team structure.
* Validate changes by triggering test alerts where applicable.
* Document any updates made for future reference.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Sentry reflects the updated MIO team ownership.
* Alerts and notifications are correctly routed to the appropriate MIO channels.
* Changes are tested and verified for accuracy.
